intro: Calceolaria triphylla, commonly known as the three-leaved slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, slipper-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three parts, giving it its common name. The flowers are usually violet or purple in color and bloom during the spring and early summer.
